item.title: Projects
(g)o (w)eb (s)erver
item.description: Deploying your personal website onto github pages is so 2013. Why avoid the hassle of self-hosting with a static site generator and server? Why not just use something tried and tested by the community? It’s just not as fun … and I didn’t feel like studying for a final one afternoon. So here’s a simple 111-line golang webserver that you can use to deploy your personal website. There’s also some cute figlet art
